      • emitBoundsCheck

        public void emitBoundsCheck​(int lowerBound,
                            int upperBound)
        Generates code that throws an error when the top stack value is smaller than lowerBound or greater than or equal to upperBound. Otherwise, the topmost stack element is left untouched.
        Parameters:
        lowerBound - Minimum value (inclusive)
        upperBound - Maximum value (exclusive)

        Parameters:
        decl - Declared Entity to add

      • loadLocalValue

        public Instruction loadLocalValue​(int wordSize,
                                  int offset)
        Emit a load instruction for an entity local to the function. Addressing on the stack will be relative to register LB.
        Parameters:
        wordSize - Number of words to load
        offset - Offset from LB.
        Returns:
        The generated instruction.

                             int wordSize,
                             int offset)
        Emit a load instruction for an entity. Addressing on the stack will be relative to the given register.
        Parameters:
        register - Register used for address resolution
        wordSize - Number of words to load
        offset - Offset from the given Register
        Returns:
        The generated instruction

      • loadAddress

        public Instruction loadAddress​(Register register,
                               int offset)
        Load an address relative to a register onto the stack. Loaded address equals register value + offset.
        Parameters:
        register - Base register
        offset - Offset from the register
        Returns:
        The generated instruction

      • emitPop

        public Instruction emitPop​(int resultSize,
                           int popSize)
        Emit a pop instruction. The pop instruction pops a result of size resultSize from the stack, deletes another popSize words from the stack and pushes the result back on the stack.
        Parameters:
        resultSize - Size of the result
        popSize - Number of words to delete
        Returns:
        The generated instruction

        Parameters:
        size - Number of words to push
        Returns:
        The generated instruction

      • emitErr

        public Instruction emitErr()
        Emits a call to the Primitive.err primitive, which consumes a string id to be used as error message.
        Returns:
        The generated instruction

      • emitIntegerNegation

        public Instruction emitIntegerNegation()
        Emits an Integer Negation, which consumes the topmost Element of the stack, and pushes its Negation onto the stack. The consumed Element is interpreted as Integer Number.
        Returns:
        The generated instruction

      • emitIntegerMultiplication

        public Instruction emitIntegerMultiplication()
        Emits an Integer Multiplication, which consumes the two topmost Elements of the stack, multiplies them and pushed the result onto the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Integer Numbers.
        Returns:
        The generated instruction

      • emitIntegerDivision

        public Instruction emitIntegerDivision()
        Emits an Integer Division, which consumes the two topmost Elements of the stack, divides the lower one by the upper one, and pushes the result onto the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Integer Numbers.
        Returns:
        The generated instruction

      • emitIntegerAddition

        public Instruction emitIntegerAddition()
        Emits an Integer Addition, which consumes the two topmost Elements of the stack, adds them up and pushes the result onto the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Integer Numbers.
        Returns:
        The generated instruction

      • emitIntegerSubtraction

        public Instruction emitIntegerSubtraction()
        Emits an Integer Subtraction, which consumes the two topmost Elements of the stack, subtracts the upper one from the lower one and pushes the result to the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Integer Numbers.
        Returns:
        The generated instruction

      • emitIntegerExponentiation

        public Instruction emitIntegerExponentiation()
        Emits an Integer Exponentiation, which consumes the two topmost Elements of the stack. The topmost is interpreted as the power, the one below as base. The result is than pushed onto the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Integer Numbers.
        Returns:
        The generated instruction

      • emitIntegerComparison

        public Instruction emitIntegerComparison​(Compare.Comparison comparison)
        Emits an Integer Comparison Operation, which consumes the two topmost Elements of the stack, and pushes the Comparison Result onto the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Integer Numbers.
        Parameters:
        comparison - Comparison Operator
        Returns:
        The generated instruction

        public Instruction emitFloatNegation()
        Emits a Floating Point Negation, which consumes the topmost Element of the stack, and pushes its Negation onto the stack. The consumed Elements are interpreted as Floating Point Numbers.
        Returns:
        The generated instruction

        Returns:
        The generated instruction
